uk.nhs.interoperability.transport

Interface ITKSender

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ITKSenderWSImpl

    public interface ITKSender
    Interface that represents the transport neutral interface for sending ITK messages to a remote destination. The interface provides both synchronous and asynchronous operations where synchronous and asynchronous represent the perspective of the the application rather than necessarily the one or more underlying transport hops.
    Since:
    version 0.1
    Author:
    Michael Odling-Smee, Nicholas Jones

    • Method Detail

      • send

        void send(ITKTransportRoute destination,
        ITKMessage request)
          throws ITKMessagingException
        Operation that allows a business payload and ITK wrappers (e.g. DistributionEnvelope) to be sent to the destination service/system via the transport specific implementation.

        Expected to be used in conjunction with ITKMessageSender.send(ITKMessage) for the specific transport associated with the service
        Parameters:
        destination - The ITKTransportRoute providing the transport invocation path for this operation
        request - This is the ITK Wrapped message that is being sent.
        Throws:
        ITKMessagingException - If the destination is null, the request is null, or if there is transport timeout or error or if there is a technical exception invoking the service provider (for instance if a SOAP fault is returned by the service provider)

      • sendSync

        ITKMessage sendSync(ITKTransportRoute destination,
                  ITKMessage request)
                    throws ITKMessagingException
        Operation that allows a business payload and ITK wrappers (e.g. DistributionEnvelope) to be sent synchronously to the destination service/system via the transport specific implementation.

        Expected to be used in conjunction with ITKMessageSender.sendSync(ITKMessage) for the specific transport associated with the service.
        Parameters:
        destination - The ITKTransportRoute providing the transport invocation path for this operation
        request - This is the ITK Wrapped message that is being sent.
        Throws:
        ITKMessagingException - If the destination is null, the request is null, or if there is transport timeout or error or if there is a technical exception invoking the service provider (for instance if a SOAP fault is returned by the service provider)

      • sendAysnc

        void sendAysnc(ITKTransportRoute destination,
             ITKMessage request)
               throws ITKMessagingException
        Operation that allows a business payload and ITK wrappers (e.g. DistributionEnvelope) to be sent asynchronously to the destination service/system via the transport specific implementation.

        Expected to be used in conjunction with ITKMessageSender.sendAsync(ITKMessage) for the specific transport associated with the service.
        Parameters:
        destination - The ITKTransportRoute providing the transport invocation path for this operation
        request - This is the ITK Wrapped message that is being sent.
        Throws:
        ITKMessagingException - If the destination is null, the request is null, or if there is transport timeout or error or if there is a technical exception invoking the transport for the first leg of the routed message's path to the service provider (depending on the deployment landscape this could be an exception returned by the service provider if there is only one leg for the routed message)
